job.title: je
job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-09-01T19:18:45.000Z", "description": "

Description:

  • Person leaving \u2013 moving, wanted a hybrid model,
  • Python, kubernetes, containerization, terraform, ansible
  • Apex downloads \u2013 used python,
  • Have an SRE \u2013 junior resource \u2013 offshore partner \u2013 managing that offshore resource
  • He was introducing their stack into kubernetes and docker
  • Setting up new environments
  • In charge of their release CI/CD pipeline
  • Bash script
  • Python nice to have

Responsibilities

  • Manage deployments in AWS to support workloads and services
  • Establish end-to-end monitoring and alerting on all critical components of the applications, including availability, latency and overall system health
  • Participate in the on-call rotation supporting the platform and/or the production application(s)
  • Work with development teams to make sure applications are production ready, scalable and reliable from the ground up
  • Perform deployment, configuration changes, and integration testing of the workload and services
  • Debug infrastructure/services/workloads and provide failure/root cause analysis
  • Write automation code for provisioning and operating infrastructure at massive scale
  • Work with security team to remediate security findings and implementing security features

Requirements

  • 5+ years of AWS experience
  • 5+ year of system engineering experience
  • 2-3 years of DevOps experience
  • Proficient in tool development using one or more programming languages such as: Java, Ruby, Python, Perl and C. Passion for eliminating repetitive manual processes using automation and experience with Devops automation tools such as Terraform, Ansible, helm charts, Jenkins/Gitlab etc.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipeline configuration, deployment, and support
  • Understanding of DBs such as MySQL, ElasticSearch.
  • Deep understanding of the Linux Operating System, including: Kernel, Memory, Process, Threads, Static / Shared Libraries, IPC, Signals.
  • Understanding of standard networking protocols and components such as: HTTP, DNS, ECMP, TCP/IP, ICMP, the OSI Model, Subnetting and Load Balancing strategies.
  • Knowledge of best practices related to security, performance, and disaster recovery
  • Docker / Kubernetes experience
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Has general security awareness to support security remediation related to infrastructure
  • Must have strong infrastructure background
